page.title: 16THE HISTORY OF PORLOCK
page.content: In 1885 a skeleton of one of the {Beaker People}was dug up on Porlock Hill suggesting a settlement as early as the{Bronze Age.}The{Saxons}gave the town its{name}which means a 'locked port'.Porlock Weir is not mentioned until the 1400's and it is probable that a harbour once existed on the marshes.Originally settlers came to Porlock because of fertile ground and sheltered position.Porlock farmers still win{international prizes}for their barley.{Vikings}attacked Porlock in the 800's.In the 1st{Domesday Book the town was divided into 2 manors, Dovri and Portloc.The 2 were made one parish in 1932.a main industry earlier this century was oak bark{tanning}of leather.Porlock is famous for its long,steep hill.The first car climbed it in 1912;it wasn't tarred until 1928
